ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl

Class Splicer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl.Source
          • ca.uqac.lif.cep.epl.Splicer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable

    public class Splicer
extends Source
    Joins multiple traces as a single one. The splicer is given multiple input traces. It feeds the events of the first one until it does not yield any new event. Then it starts feeding events of the second one, and so on.

    Currently, the splicer is implemented as a 0:n processor, and the processors it is given must have an input arity of 0.

    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Resets the processor. This has for effect of flushing the contents of all input and output event queues. If the processor has an internal state, this should also reset this state to its "initial" settings (whatever that means in your context).
        Overrides:
